prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] First, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face_1) which includes the following loops and curves: *Loop 1* 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0008, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.0008, 0.0], End Point [0.0008, 0.0075] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.0008, 0.0075], End Point [0.0126, 0.0075] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.0126, 0.0075], End Point [0.0244, 0.0075] 5. Line 5: Start Point [0.0244, 0.0075], End Point [0.0244, 0.0] 6. Line 6: Start Point [0.0244, 0.0], End Point [0.0253, 0.0] 7. Line 7: Start Point [0.0253, 0.0], End Point [0.0253, 0.0083] 8. Line 8: Start Point [0.0253, 0.0083], End Point [0.0126, 0.0083] 9. Line 9: Start Point [0.0126, 0.0083], End Point [0.0, 0.0083] 10. Line 10: Start Point [0.0, 0.0083], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This loop defines the boundary of the rectangular prism's top face, with a total of 10 lines. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale = 0.0253. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to create the 3D model. Set the extrude depth towards the normal as 0.1875 and the extrude depth opposite the normal as 0.1875. The dimensions of the part can be described as: - Length: 0.0253 (0.0253 meters) - Width: 0.375 (0.375 meters) - Height: 0.0253 (0.0253 meters) The resulting part should resemble a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part will be used in subsequent operations to create the final shape.</description>

There is only one loop (loop\\_1) in this sketch. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0165 and the extrude depth opposite normal to 0.0. The sketch scale should be 0.75. The boolean operation will result in the creation of a new solid body. This part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Its length is 0.75, width is 0.75, and height is 0.0165. Part 2: (Instructions to follow based on additional JSON data) ... Be sure to use clear and concise language, avoid unnecessary explanations, and use numbers to denote the parts, sketches, curves, loops, or faces. prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 For the sketch, begin by drawing a face (face\\_1) and then create the following loop using the specified points and curve types: - loop\\_1 - line\\_1: Start Point - (0.0, 0.0), End Point - (0.0752, 0.0) - arc\\_1: Start Point - (0.0752, 0.0), Mid Point - (0.1065, 0.012), End Point - (0.1218, 0.0418) - line\\_2: Start Point - (0.1218, 0.0418), End Point - (0.1992, 0.75) - line\\_3: Start Point - (0.1992, 0.75), End Point - (0.0, 0.75) - line\\_4: Start Point - (0.0, 0.75), End Point - (0.0, 0.0) Each loop must be closed, and a loop cannot consist of both a line and a circle or an arc and a circle. The sketch should look like a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. For the extrusion of the sketch, set the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0234 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.75 - operation: Create a new solid body Extrude the sketch along the normal direction to create the final 3D model. The dimensions of the final shape and intermediate parts: - Final shape: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. - Length: 0.0234 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 - Intermediate part dimensions: - Length: 0.1863 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 This concludes the instructions for Part 1.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Central Hole Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole, resembling a tube or pipe. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.135, 0.24, 0) with no rotation. 1.1 Create the first face of the sketch: - Draw a circle centered at (0.135, 0.135) with a radius of 0.135. - Constrain the circle to be closed. 1.2 Create the second face of the sketch: - Draw another circle centered at (0.135, 0.135) with a radius of 0.06. - Constrain the circle to be closed. - Ensure that these two circles are concentric. 1.3 Proceed with the following extrusion: - Scale the sketch by the factor 0.27. - Extrude the sketch by 0.135 towards the normal direction. - The 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' operation will be used for this extrusion. The resulting object should have dimensions: - Length: 0.27 - Width: 0.27 - Height: 0.135 Part 2: Rectangular Metal Bracket with Central Hole Construct a rectangular metal bracket with a hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 2.1 Create the first face of the sketch: - Begin at a start point of (0, 0.1148). - Draw an arc in counterclockwise direction, ending at (0.54, 0.1148) with a midpoint at (0.27, 0). - Constrain the arc to be closed. - Draw a line connecting the end points of the arc. 2.2 Create the second face of the sketch: - Draw a circle centered at (0.27, 0.375) with a radius of 0.135. - Constrain the circle to be closed. 2.3 Create the third face of the sketch: - Draw a circle centered at (0.27, 0.645) with a radius of 0.0356. - Constrain the circle to be closed. 2.4 Proceed with the following extrusion: - Scale the sketch by the factor 0.75. - Extrude the sketch by 0.09 towards the normal direction. - The 'JoinFeatureOperation' operation will be used for this extrusion. The resulting object should have dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.09</description>
